text: 12 oz CaN .. golden .. light hue .. medium foam .. crisp butter straw .. light medium mouth .. good kolsch .. . The body count is piling up!!!!!
This is Not a Koelsch. It is a very nice beer though. No koelsch yeast aroma. Flavor is too hoppy. Malt flavor is nice but muddled by hops. Finishes grassy with noble hops like a German pale ale.
Pretty average easy drinking beer. Not much distinguishable in the aroma. Super pale clear yellow. Refreshing. Decent hot day backyard beer.
Shared 12 oz. can. Clear straw with a white head. Aroma of grains with lemon and citrus hints. Taste follows nose. Very crisp finish.

Aroma: kind of earthy with a metal tang; Appearance: clear, pale straw pour with thin white head that disappears quickly; Taste: faintly bready but mostly watery; Palate: very light bodied with short finish; Overall: typical kolsch; not that exciting.

Can. Pours a very light gold with just a hint of green; head is bright white, pillowy, mixed-grained, and very solid with lace. Nose is apple, banana, papaya, wheat cracker, lavender, and a little white pepper. On the tongue, its really substantial, with lemon, lemon peel, and fresh biscuits up front; on the midpalate theres more citrus and more grain, with a chewy fresh bread note and a very clean finish. Hefty; this is a rarity for me, a worthwhile American kolsch. Long lemony finish; sticks around and reminds you how good it was.
This is a Kolsch. Pours a clear straw yellow color. Taste is slightly fruity with a slight lemon finish. Crisp and fairly clean.
Thin yellow pour, decent white head. Nose is straight ahead malt. Middle shows a honey like sweetness backed by some hay. Finish shows hint of hops.
Lightly hazed straw pour with a white head. Sweet grainy aroma with some lemon. Taste is grains, lemon, and grass. Light and crisp.
On tap at Stanleys Pizza. Pours a clear gold with small white head that lasts. The aroma is grass, straw, lemon zest. Medium body, similar flavors to nose, light bitter finish, crisp, very good.
Crisp, pure, clear golden color with a white head. Aroma is grain. flavor is cereal. Hops are Czech. Good beer.

Aroma of grain - clean and fresh. Pours a clear golden hue with a rapidly dissipating white head and slight lacing. The taste is light bread and grain with whiny dry finish. Medium body and medium carbonation. Overall, a nice example of the Kölsch style.
Clear yellow color. Thing white ring around the top. Clove lemonlight sweetness, lightly bitter, fizzy,
Draft at the source. Hazy golden yellow color, bright white head with solid lacing. Explosive aroma of tropical fruit and tangerine. Taste is bitter orange peel, grass, breadfruit. Very nice.
